Search String: "multiobjective OR multi-objective OR multicriteria OR multi-criteria) AND dam removal"
Authors: Guetz, K; Joyal, T; Dickson, B; Perry, D
Article Title: Prioritizing dams for removal to advance restoration and conservation efforts in the western United States
Notes: incorporated in objectives and metrics doc
Notes on MCDA: I am assuming that prioritizing sites with low % impervious cover, flow alteration, and high restored connectivity, are located in fish priority areas, even when not explicitly stated are aimed toward promoting a diverse assemblage of freshwater organisms. They also included floodplain alteration which could be related to water quality as an objective but this isn't stated. Social feasibility seems like a means objective rather than a fundamental objective which is why I don't include it here.

Search String: "multiobjective OR multi-objective OR multicriteria OR multi-criteria) AND dam removal"
Authors: Yang, M; Qian, X; Zhang, YH; Sheng, JB; Shen, DL; Ge, Y
Article Title: Spatial Multicriteria Decision Analysis of Flood Risks in Aging-Dam Management in China: A Framework and Case Study
Source Title: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH AND PUBLIC HEALTH
Notes: only briefly skimmed, may hand off to Matt and Dan
Notes on MCDA: This MCDA is distinct in that the criteria are related to the consequences of flood risk which has economic, social, and environmental dimensions. I therefore only included reduce flood risk as an objective for this study. Flood-induced erosion, the environmental criterion, was not explicitly related to an environmental outcome.

Notes: Small hydropower siting optimization model that balances hydropower potential with diadromous fish passage. Authors: Tao, M; Zhang, X; Wang, SF; Cao, WZ; Jiang, Y
Article Title: Life cycle assessment on lead-zinc ore mining and beneficiation in China
Notes: not about dams

Authors: Sethi, SA; O'Hanley, JR; Gerken, J; Ashline, J; Bradley, C
Article Title: High value of ecological information for river connectivity restoration
Notes: take a habitat approach to anadromous fish connectivity, but one that integrates the life history of the organism
Notes on MCDA: included implementation cost although this is parameterized as a constraint (given a budget of $X what is the optimal solution)

Authors: Ioannidou, C; O'Hanley, JR
Article Title: The importance of spatiotemporal fish population dynamics in barrier mitigation planning
Notes: use population viability analysis with variable homing frequency to model optimal dam removals for coho salmon
Notes on MCDA: included implementation cost although this is parameterized as a constraint (given a budget of $X what is the optimal solution)

Authors: Munsch, SH; Greene, CM; Mantua, NJ; Satterthwaite, WH
Article Title: One hundred-seventy years of stressors erode salmon fishery climate resilience in California's warming landscape
Notes: not about dam removal; describes how stressors imposed on rivers in the CA central valley reduced the resiliency of the salmon fishery to climate change

Authors: Fryirs, KA; Brierley, GJ
Article Title: Assessing the geomorphic recovery potential of rivers: forecasting future trajectories of adjustment for use in management
Notes: potentially interesting read for the discussion about depressurizing

Authors: King, S; O'Hanley, JR
Article Title: Optimal fish passage barrier removal --revisited
Notes: deals more with the algorithm to solve the optimization problem once you have parameterized it; allows consideration of multiple linked scenarios rather than individual structure prioritizations
Notes on MCDA: included prevent spread of invasive species because they mention a way to parameterize their model to include this as a constraint even though the application to the state of Maine did not include invasives

Authors: Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife
Source Title: Fish Passage and Surface Water Diversion Screening Assessment and Prioritization Manual
Notes: skimmed, relied mostly on description in Kocovsky et al.

Authors: Milt, A.W.; P.J. Doran; M.C. Ferris; A.T. Moody; T.M. Neeson; P.B. McIntyre
Article Title: Local-scale Benefits of River Connectivity Restoration Planning Beyond Jurisdictional Boundaries
Notes: another tradeoff between removal cost a fish passage; this analysis specifically examined the benefits of coordinating removal outside of jurisdictional boundaries

Authors: Mader, H; Maier, C.
Article Title: A method for prioritizing the reestablishment of river continuity in Austrian rivers
Notes: scoring and ranking approach for evaluating the benefits of barrier removal; I don't understand all of the parameters

Authors: The Nature Conservancy
Article Title: Improving hydropower outcomes through system-scale planning: An example from Myanmar
Source Title: United Kingdom Department for International Development
Notes: dam construction optimization
Notes on MCDA: other objectives potentially relevant to dam removal: navigation, includes both firm generation and average annual generation

Authors: Diebel, M. W.; M. Fedora; S. Congswell; J.R. O'Hanley
Article Title: Effects of road crossings on habitat connectivity for stream-resident fish

Authors: Olford
Article Title: Thesis

Article Title: Cost-effectiveness analysis for complex managed hydrosystems: An application to the Columbia River Basin

Article Title: Trading-off fish biodiversity, food security, and hydropower in the Mekong River Basin

Article Title: Atlantic Costal Fish Habitat Partnership: Fish Habitat Conservation Area Mapping and Prioritization Project
Notes: priotizes watersheds not barriers for removal

Article Title: California Passage Assesment Database
Chesapeake Fish Passage Prioritization Tool
Notes: prioritizes for diadromous, brook trout, or resident but not multiple objectives

Article Title: Maine Aquatic Barrier Prioritization
Notes: looks like similar underlying model to the Chesapeake Fish Passage tool

Article Title: Fishwerks
Floodplain Assessments: Active River Area
Notes: does not look like a dam removal MCDA

Article Title: Northeast Aquatic Barrier Prioritization
Notes: similar to Maine and Chesapeake prioritization in focus on anadromous species

Article Title: Southeast Aquatic Connectivity Assessment Project
Notes: seems like the most comprehensive of the prioritization tools wrt objectives and data
Notes on MCDA: include social feasibility as a criterion; unclear how they define it, give you the option to filter by whether something is a low-head dam although most are unknown, don't include hydropower capacity although do note if the dam is a hydropower dam

Article Title: Mississippi River Basin Floodplain Tool
Notes: cool tool but not related to dam removal

Article Title: MA DER Restoration Potential Tool
Notes: mapped barriers and estimated ecological benefit of removal; did not include because it does not include multiple objectives

Article Title: FishXing
Notes: about culvert design

Article Title: Washington State Fish Passage
Notes: mapped barriers and their estimated fish passability; did not include because it does not specify multiple objectives
